disobedience.question: Was I disobedient to my parents?
disobedience.description: As per the fourth commandment, it's a child's duty to respond to parental love, wisdom, and respect with obedience.

disobedience.question: When feeling frustrated with others within the Church, did I reject the unity of the Body of Christ?
disobedience.description: Rejecting Church unity due to frustration with individuals is sinful because it confuses the Church's divine nature and eternal truths with the human imperfections of its members, while also violating Christ's prayer "that they may all be one."

disobedience.question: When frustrated with individuals within the Church, did I reject the unity of the Body of Christ?
disobedience.description: Rejecting Church unity due to frustration with individuals is sinful because it confuses the Church's divine nature and eternal truths with the human imperfections of its members, while also violating Christ's prayer "that they may all be one."

disobedience.question: Did I intentionally choose to skip a day of fasting during Ash Wednesday without a valid reason?
disobedience.description: This is considered sinful because deliberately disregarding prescribed days of fasting represents disobedience to Church authority and fails to honor our spiritual obligation to practice self-denial and penance during sacred times.

disobedience.question: Have I intentionally chosen to become sterilized, thereby rejecting God's plan for my fertility?
disobedience.description: This is considered sinful because deliberately altering one's fertility represents an act of defiance against God and implies we know better than divine wisdom, placing our desires for control above trust in God's plan for our lives.

disobedience.question: Did I speak disrespectfully about the Church?
disobedience.description: Mocking the church shows contempt for Christ's established institution on earth, disrespects the Body of Christ, and undermines the Church's divine authority as guided by the Holy Spirit.

disobedience.question: Did I use my words to ridicule the Church?
disobedience.description: Mocking the church shows contempt for Christ's established institution on earth, disrespects the Body of Christ, and undermines the Church's divine authority as guided by the Holy Spirit.

condoning.question: Did I ever tell fellow Catholics that they could skip receiving sacraments or attending Mass?
condoning.description: One of the spiritual works of mercy is to admonish the sinner and to correct them out of love and charity instead of condoning sin.

condoning.description: One of the spiritual works of mercy is to admonish the sinner and to correct them out of love and charity instead of condoning sin.

extracted_data_phrases: by avoiding conversations that could have guided them in their faith

condoning.description: Permitting a child to continue in error by avoiding difficult conversations is sinful because it neglects our God-given parental duty to guide and form our children's moral and spiritual development, placing our own comfort above their eternal wellbeing.

condoning.question: Did I condone a funeral where human remains were not properly buried?
condoning.description: Failing to advocate for proper burial of human remains is considered sinful as the Church teaches that the body is sacred and deserves reverent burial, with scattering or keeping remains being contrary to the dignity of the human body and resurrection belief.

extracted_data_phrases: to influences that could lead them into sin

condoning.description: Parents have to protect their children's well-being, guarding them from harmful elements that could damage their faith or lead them into sin.

condoning.question: Did you condone another Catholic to marry outside the Church through your words?
condoning.description: Marriage is a sacrament within the Catholic faith and thus giving approval and not admonishing the action gives scandal by condoning.

condoning.question: Did I approve another Catholic's decision to marry outside the Church?
condoning.description: Marriage is a sacrament within the Catholic faith and thus giving approval and not admonishing the action gives scandal by condoning.

condoning.question: Did I give my approval to another Catholic who was planning to marry outside of the Church?

scandal.question: Did I forgo a valid Catholic marriage, potentially causing harm to my partner through an unlicit union?

extracted_data_phrases: in doing something that led them to commit a sinful act

uncharity.question: Did I prioritize my own needs over others' interests in making financial decisions?

uncharity.question: Did I lose my patience in interactions with others, potentially leading to uncharitable words?

incontinence.question: Did I exhibit self-control when engaging in conversations, and did I refrain from speaking words that were hurtful or unbecoming to others?
incontinence.description: This sin of incontinence shows a lack of self-restraint and violates the dignity of others.

incontinence.question: Did you lack self-control and use coarse language when speaking with others, such that their dignity was offended?
incontinence.description: This sin of incontinence shows a lack of self-restraint and violates the dignity of others.

extracted_data_phrases: in eating or drinking beyond what 's reasonable
gluttony.question: Did I overindulge in eating or drinking beyond what's reasonable, such that my attachment to comfort and pleasure has become excessive?
gluttony.description: This sin of gluttony demonstrates an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejects the call to temperance.

extracted_data_phrases: in eating or drinking beyond what 's reasonable
especially during social gatherings or when engaging in activities that bring me pleasure
in activities that bring me pleasure
gluttony.question: Did I overindulge in eating or drinking beyond what's reasonable, especially during social gatherings or when engaging in activities that bring me pleasure?
gluttony.description: This sin of gluttony demonstrates an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejects the call to temperance.

extracted_data_phrases: over my financial obligations or family needs
prodigality.question: Have I allowed excessive and wasteful indulgence in entertainment activities to take precedence over my financial obligations or family needs?
prodigality.description: This sin violates the virtue of stewardship by recklessly risking resources God has entrusted to us, while potentially harming our ability to provide for family and those in need.

extracted_data_phrases: for my family 's needs or financial obligations
such as a costly hobby or entertainment
prodigality.question: Have I used money meant for my family's needs or financial obligations to support an excessive and wasteful activity, such as a costly hobby or entertainment?
prodigality.description: This sin violates the virtue of stewardship by recklessly risking resources God has entrusted to us, while potentially harming our ability to provide for family and those in need.

extracted_data_phrases: through conversations with friends or acquaintances
gossip.question: Have I taken pleasure in sharing others' private affairs, even if what I shared was true, through conversations with friends or acquaintances?
gossip.description: Gossip violates human dignity and charity by harming others' reputations for our own entertainment or pride.

gossip.question: Have I shared others' private affairs through casual conversations, even if what I shared was true?
gossip.description: Gossip violates human dignity and charity by harming others' reputations for our own entertainment or pride.
